alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Crawford County through 645 PM EDT... At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Linesville, or 14 miles west of Meadville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Meadville, Linesville, Harmonsburg, Pymatuning North, Pymatuning Central, Saegertown, Conneautville, Conneaut Lake, Springboro, Blooming Valley, Venango, Woodcock and Conneaut Lakeshore. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern Ohio...and northwestern Pennsylvania.
